newsitem.title: USA: Genrad to redeem $50 mln of convertible debt.
newsitem.headline: Genrad to redeem $50 mln of convertible debt.

text.p: GenRad Inc said on Tuesday it was redeeming all $50 million of its 7-1/4 percent convertible subordinated debentures due in 2011 at par plus accrued interest to the redemption date.
Redemption is set for November 6. The company has received a financing commitment from BankBoston, GenRad said.
Debenture holders may choose to convert their debentures into Genrad common stock at a rate of one share for each $14.375 in principal, it said.
Genrad shares were halted on the New York Stock Exchange. The stock closed at 18-1/8 on Monday.
Debentures submitted for conversion must be received by State Street Bank and Trust Co no later than the close of business on October 30, Genrad said.
At the end of its third quarter Genrad had about 24.2 million fully diluted shares outstanding.
